intro: Nardosmia laevigata, commonly known as the smooth-leafed nardosmia, is a flowering plant native to the southern regions of Africa. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, often fragrant leaves and flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, and its leaves are smooth and lance-shaped. Nardosmia laevigata is valued for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
